caption.p: Overall view of the network expansion method. (A) Summary graphical visualization of the application (using four parameters settings) of NES 2RA to the ERFs LGN using data from the Vespucci compendium. Each tile, including all the genes of the LGN, generated during the subsetting step, is analysed using the PC-algorithm that runs on the volunteersâ€™ computers, made available through the gene@home BOINC project. The post-processing takes as input all the resulting networks and ranks the genes using their relative frequency, measured as the number of times a gene was found connected to the input LGN. In the final expansion network, the nodes are the LGN (in yellow) and the top-ranking genes of the aggregated list (in light blue), whereas the edges derive from the union of all the found interactions. (B) Details on the internal steps of the PC-algorithm that, starting from a complete graph, iteratively searches separation sets that allows the cut of an edge. For each tile, the result of the application of the PC-algorithm is a network.
